poem:
Title: "Inaturality"

Grinds of the mill, muffled in th' newspaper ink,
Britain in the rut, vast economic shrink.
Looms the destitute dawn, dark with silent lament,
Seventy years of living, in striving armament.
Recovery...a distant dream, in cycles robust,
Shallow though it seems, in trust we must.
Melancholic perspective, in such times ignite,
Awake, for we need growth, to break the darkest night.
